item.title: A Meta-Post for a Meta-Blog
item.description: Welcome to the Informatics Meta-Blog Knowledge is power…and best shared with others. This is the place where any informatician, innovator, or entrepreneur can crowd-source contribute and build upon each others' knowledge. Many of the things I post here will be open-source and moderately technical, but that’s only my preference. If there’s something else you want to share about healthcare, informatics, innovation, or entrepreneurship, please feel free. Just don’t use this as a shameless plug for your work.

item.title: PRAPARE Survey
item.description: PRAPARE SURVEY This is a work in progress. The Protocol for Responding to and Assessing Patients' Assets, Risks, and Experiences (PRAPARE) survey was recreated in a Flutter environment using its LOINC FHIR specification. The app directly loads the FHIR spec (albeit with some basic modifications to the original FHIR JSON to more closely match the initial survey). It has basic validation in place for survey completion. Features Personal Characteristics Personal Characteristics, filled out Social and Emotional Health

item.title: AMIA Symptom Tracker
item.description: AMIA Symptom Tracker This was the demo application used for live-coding in the 4-hour Flutter workshop given at AMIA’s 2020 Virtual Clinical Informatics Conference. A total of 6 informaticians hosted this workshop. Features Welcome Screen, live-coded in full Symptom Tracker Dashboard, live-coded in full Check-In Screen, live-coded in full Firebase Puns, created by audience using Live Share Flutter / Firebase connection, previously created while live-coding FHIR Package Demo, creating live patients on HAPI and Aidbox FHIR servers.
